A.2.5 CO2 System - To Inspect, Maintain and Verification checks for Liquid CO2 Tanks
Scope of works,
a) Inspection check on CO2 tank safety devices (where applicable)
b) Inspection check on pipe leakage and passing valves  (where applicable)
c) Check for external damage, wear and tear of valves, pipe and fittings (where applicable)
d) Verification check on tank equipment and instrument (where applicable)
e) Vacuum check and abnormal pressure rising, sweating  or condensation on LCO2 tanks (where applicable)
f) LCO2 tank safety valves pop tests (where applicable)
g) Generation of inspection report and documentation

A.2.20 Supply labour, material, tools and transport to carry out fabrication and installation of metal protective cover for one side of the SWRO/LPRO Train. The purpose of the protective cover is to deflect/contain any projectile (e.g. 3" victaulic coupling) that may arise from equipment damage. The SWRO and LPRO system is normally pressurised at about 50 bar. The protective mesh cover should be designed to not give way in the event of any projectile hit.
Size: approx. (L-2.6m x H- 2.4m x W-2.0m) x 3 numbers
Material: Mild Steel (Frame with C5M Coating and Mesh to be Hot Dipped Galvanised Steel)

A.2.22 Supply labour, material, tools and transport to carry out fabrication and installation of neutralisation tank water inlet strainer.
a. Design, construct and install frame (Mild Steel, C5M epoxy painted) for 1 pipe leading to the neutralisation tank; and

A.2.25 Supply labour, material, tools and transport to carry out fabrication and installation of walkway ramp up to 300mm Height per meter (able to handle the nominal load of about 200kg). The ramp shall be designed with anti-slip system. The material should be marine corrosion resistant with necessary painting (e.g. yellow/white pattern) for hazard identification. The cost is based on per m run of the walkway ramp.

a. Repair damaged area by removing existing weldment by hand grinding and other pre-welding preparation procedures (if required by the Board);
b. Perform Super Duplex welding repair with high tensile strength electrode 120ksi superior crack resistance; or other suitable welding repair methods.
c. Perform LPI along the welding joints after welding repair works
d. Perform radiography inspection on the newly welded areas.
A.2.190 To inspect and repair the defective areas around one flange end of one 14" Super Duplex ER Vessel
a. Repair damaged area by cutting flange end (as required for the works);
b. Perform super duplex re-building and repair on the cut flange end with high tensile strength electrode 120ksi superior crack resistance; or other suitable welding repair methods.
c. Weld back the flange end to the ER Vessel and final on-site machining to suit the on-site interfacing equipment;
c. Perform LPI along the welding joints after welding repair works
d. Perform radiography inspection on the newly welded areas
e. Perform hydrotest at test pressure of up to 70 bar

a. Cleaning and marking for all necessary alignment places

X3.47.1 Rental of portable CCTV camera with recording function and other ancillaries (minimum of 4 hours-use per deployment)
CCTV technical specification
The minimum requirements for the CCTV camera to be provided are as below:
Full High Definition (FHD) 1080pixel, 25/30 frame per sec
Ingress Protection (IP) 66
Pan/Tilt/Zoom (PTZ); 10x Optical zoom
Able to operate under low light and night time condition (i.e. 0.01 Lux and with Infrared technology)
Battery shall last about 12 hours on a single charge (including maintenance/ replacement of battery to ensure continuous operations of the system)
Able to export the video footage or parts of it into portable storage device in a format which is playable on a Windows-based Computer.
Video footage shall include date/time stamp for the purpose of audit trail/evidence
Recording function
1Terabyte (TB) or Sufficient storage for about 15 days of video footage at Full HD resolution.
Option to record the footage at different frame rate to optimize the storage space.
General
The CCTV system shall ensure that recorded video is intact, cannot be altered and available for post event analysis.
If required, the Contractor shall retrieve and provide the video footages to PUB.
The Contractor shall not share any information or data with any third parties without PUB’s approval.
